newsitem.title: USA: Corning board approves terms for spinoffs.
newsitem.headline: Corning board approves terms for spinoffs.

text.p: Corning Inc said on Wednesday its board of directors approved terms for the spinoff of two Corning subsidiaries -- Quest Diagnostics Inc and Covance Inc -- to shareholders.

Under terms of the distribution, Corning shareholders would receive one share of Quest Diagnostics, now known as Corning Clinical Laboratories Inc, for every eight common Corning shares held on the December 31 record date, it said.
Shareholders would also receive one share of Covance, formerly known as Corning Pharmaceutical Services, for every four common Corning shares held on the record date, it said.
The company said cash would be paid to holders in lieu of fractional shares. The two subsidiaries would become independent, publicly traded companies, it said.
Corning said on November 8 it received a favorable ruling from the U.S. Internal Revenue Service for a tax-free distribution to Corning sharesholders of shares in these two new companies.
The company said it had received strong support for the spinoffs.
